intro: Helicteres orthotheca f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflowered helicteres, is a variant of the helicteres orthotheca species. It is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets and produces clusters of small, white flowers. Its flowers are typically arranged in panicles, and the plant is often found in moist, shaded environments. The botanical characteristics of this species make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
